docs.title: AlAhly Momkn – Bills & Digital Payments
docs.text:
Accept payments faster and easier while delivering a better checkout experience for your customers.

At AlAhly Momkn, we’re committed to providing secure, seamless, and fast payment solutions tailored to your business. Our mission is to help you serve more customers and grow your sales through flexible payment methods and modern POS technologies.

Popular All Services

docs.title: 🚀 Overview
docs.text: This section outlines the developer's journey and how to make a successful API call as quickly and efficiently as possible.

docs.title: 🔄 Onboarding
docs.text: To begin integrating with our APIs, follow this quick-start flow:

docs.title: 1. 📝 Register New Account
docs.text:
Developers must first register through the Admin Portal to obtain their API credentials. The required credentials include:

  • Username
  • AccountID
  • Password

These are issued by the system administrator upon successful onboarding.

docs.title: 2. 🔐 Authenticate to Obtain Access Token
docs.text: Use the credentials to call the Authentication API and retrieve a valid JWT access token. This token will be used to authorize all subsequent API calls.

docs.title: 3. 🧩 Service Onboarding Requirement
docs.text:
Before invoking the API flow, ensure that the target service is predefined or has been onboarded via the Administration Tool.

You can retrieve the configuration of a predefined service using one of the following methods:

Multiple services may utilize the same API interface but require distinct configurations. These configurations can be retrieved through:

  • Service Catalog API Intended for system-to-system integration, this API delivers machine-readable configuration data, including:
  • serviceId
  • Required parameters

  • Validation constraints (e.g., regular expressions)

  • Product Catalog Presents the same configuration details in a human-readable format, suitable for manual review and operational use.

Both sources provide consistent core data. Select the appropriate option based on whether your integration is automated or user-facing.

⚠️ Important: Failure to complete this step will prevent successful execution of downstream APIs.

docs.title: 4. 🔧 Execute the Service Flow
docs.text:
Once authenticated and the service is onboarded, developers can proceed to complete the full API flow. For example:

  • Inquiry API – To retrieve service-specific data (e.g., bills, balances).
  • Fees API – To calculate applicable transaction fees.
  • Payment API – To complete and confirm the transaction.

Optional steps like Retry or Check Status may be invoked after the payment, if needed.

This complete flow ensures a secure, streamlined, and developer-friendly onboarding experience.

🔁 Supported API Flows

To simplify your integration, we've streamlined all services into just two core API flows, making implementation faster, more predictable, and easier to maintain.

Every service on our platform follows one of the following flows:

  • Inquiry → Fees → Payment – for standard services like bill payments, vouchers, and installments
  • Initiate → Confirm – for wallet-based services such as Vodafone Cash, Orange Money, and similar

  • Inquiry → Fees → Payment

    Used for the majority of services, including:

    • Bill payments
    • Vouchers
    • Top-ups
    • Installments

    Steps:

    1. Inquiry using billing account
    2. Fetch fees and validate
    3. Proceed to payment

    Getting started

  • Initiate → Confirm

    Used for cash-in / cash-out wallet services, such as:

    • Vodafone Cash
    • Orange Money
    • Etisalat Cash

    Steps:

    1. Initiate transaction
    2. Confirm with OTP

    Getting started

These flows give you full control over UI rendering and request orchestration while ensuring security and scalability across all services.

docs.title: 🧾 Overview
docs.text: The Bill Payment Gateway offers a suite of secure,APIs that enable partners and third-party applications to initiate and manage a variety of payment-related services.Our platform supports seamless transactions across multiple industries with enterprise-grade reliability.

docs.title: 🌍 Base URI
docs.text:
All API URLs use the following base:

https://api.yourdomain.com/bill-payment/v1

docs.title: 📦 API Domains
docs.text:
api-reference/
│
├── account-management/
│   └── login, refresh-token, profile
├── onboarding/
│   └── register, validate, upload-docs
├── billpayment/
│   └── inquiry, payment, reversal, status
├── service-management/
│   └── catalog, categories, parameters
├── common/
│   ├── common-errors.md
│   └── common-parameters.md

docs.title: 🔧 Key Functionalities
docs.text:
• 🔐 Secure access using token-based authentication Supports JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for authorization.

  • 📑 Comprehensive transaction logging and reconciliation Ensures transparency, traceability, and accuracy across operations.

These APIs are built on a microservices architecture, ensuring: - Scalable and resilient operations - Secure and encrypted communication - Adherence to modern compliance standards

docs.text: N/A

docs.text: N/A

docs.title: Common Errors
docs.text:
This section lists the errors common to the API of all Al Ahly Momkn services.

Error Type Description HTTP Status Code BadRequestException The submitted request is not valid (e.g., missing or incorrect input). See the error message for details. 400 ConflictException The request configuration has conflicts. Refer to the error message for details. 409 LimitExceededException The request exceeded the rate limit. Retry after the specified time. 429 TooManyRequestsException The request reached its throttling limit. Retry after the specified time. 429 UnauthorizedException The request is denied due to insufficient permissions. 401

docs.title: 🔍 Overview
docs.text: The Inquiry API allows you to get the necessary information (such as due bills) about inquirable services in order to proceed with payment.

docs.title: ⚙️ Service Parameter Configuration
docs.text: Refer to the Getting Started Guide for detailed instructions on how to retrieve and configure service parameters.

docs.title: ✅ Post-requisites
docs.text:
Following the Inquiry API, continue the service flow with:

  • Fees API
  • Payment API

Optional steps include:

  • Confirmation API
  • Cancel API
  • Retry API
  • Check Status API

docs.title: 🔐 Security
docs.text:
• Authentication: See the Headers section for more details.
  • Encryption: N/A

docs.title: 🧾 Headers
docs.text: Any request to this API requires the Authorization header which will have the token generated

docs.title: 📦 Pagination
docs.text: • N/A

docs.title: 🔍 Searching/Querying
docs.text: • N/A

docs.title: 🚦 Request Limiting
docs.text: • N/A

docs.title: 🔧 Request Syntax
docs.text:
Endpoint:

HTTPS: POST
--header 'Authorization: ••••••' 
/services/{serviceId}/inquiry

{ 
  "BillingAccount": "string", 
  "localDate": "datetime", 
  "version": "number",
  "serviceListVersion": "number",
  "Data": [
    { 
      "Key": "string", 
      "Value": "string", 
      "Name": "string" 
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: 🔗 URI Request Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Description Required How to Get serviceId The serviceId resource representing the service the client inquires about. ✅ Yes Retrieve it from the Service Catalog API and search the response by business name mentioned in the service section.

docs.title: 📤 Response Syntax
docs.text:
{
  "Code": "number",
  "Message": "string",
  "TotalAmount": "decimal",
  "Brn": "number",
  "Data": [
    {
      "Key": "string",
      "Value": "string",
      "Name": "string"
    }
  ],
  "invoices": [
    {
      "Sequence": "number",
      "alias": "string",
      "amount": "decimal",
      "minAmount": "decimal",
      "maxAmount": "decimal",
      "Data": [
        {
          "Key": "string",
          "Value": "string",
          "Name": "string"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: 🔍 Overview
docs.text: The Fees API is used after the Inquiry API to calculate applied service fees based on the provided service details before.

docs.title: ⚙️ Service Configuration
docs.text:
Several services use the same API but with different configurations. You can obtain the configuration using one of the following:

  • Service Catalog API – retrieves necessary data such as serviceId, parameters, regular expressions.

docs.title: 📘 Overview
docs.text: The Takka Pay Installment API enables merchants or third-party platforms to facilitate secure and real-time repayment of customer installment dues directly through Takka Microfinance.This API acts as a payment gateway for settling outstanding installment amounts using unique customer identifiers.

docs.title: 🏢 Business Name
docs.text: Takka

docs.title: 🔁 Service Flow
docs.text: Please refer to the Service Flow section detailed on the Installments Overview page.

docs.title: ⚙️ Service Configuration
docs.text:
Used when listing or referencing service metadata such as service name, payment type, limits, and status in catalogs or during service discovery. It is used by developers or platform administrators to configure and register the service within the system, helping define how the service behaves and interacts with the platform.

Field Value Description serviceID 362 Unique identifier of the service serviceName أقساط Display name of the service (Arabic) value 0 Default placeholder value categoryTitle (empty) Category of the service (optional) paymentModeID 1 Payment mode used status 1 Service status (1 = active, 0 = inactive) currency مصري Currency used minValue 1 Minimum transaction amount maxValue 1000000000 Maximum transaction amount interval 5 Step increment for allowed transaction amounts inquirable true Whether an inquiry is required before payment billPaymentModeID 1 Bill payment method serviceTypeID 3 Type of service > ℹ️ Notes: > - paymentModeID, billPaymentModeID, and serviceTypeID refer to standardized options documented in the Common Parameters section.

docs.title: ⚙️ Service Parameter Configuration
docs.text:
The following parameters are used by all APIs when creating a request. Any action-specific parameters will be described in the documentation for each corresponding API.

Used by consumers or clients who will consume the service as a product.

These parameters represent the input fields required at runtime when using the service — for example: - Customer number - Biiling Account

They are essential for: - UI input forms - Request validation - API payload construction

Optional steps after executing the Payment API include:

  • Check Status API

See the error message for details. 400 ConflictException The request configuration has conflicts. Refer to the error message for details. 409 LimitExceededException The request exceeded the rate limit. Retry after the specified time. 429 TooManyRequestsException The request reached its throttling limit. Retry after the specified time. 429 UnauthorizedException The request is denied due to insufficient permissions. 401

docs.title: 💰 Inquiry → Fees → Payment Flow
docs.text:
This flow is used for most transactional services in our ecosystem. It enables clients to:

  • Retrieve billing data
  • Calculate exact fees
  • Execute and finalize the payment

    B --> C[Payment]
    C --> D{Optional Steps}
    D --> E[Retry]
    D --> F[Confirm]
    D --> G[Cancel]
    D --> H[Check Status]

docs.text: 📚 Service Docs Tree 🔍

docs.title: 🛠️ Service Catalog API (Dynamic Service Builder)
docs.text:
The Service Catalog API acts as the foundation for dynamically building and rendering services in your app. It eliminates the need to hardcode each service manually by providing all necessary configurations from the backend.

Think of it as a UI-driven service builder — your app only needs to read the config and render the inputs dynamically.

docs.title: 🧭 Sections Overview
docs.text:
• 🎯 What Is the Service Catalog
  • 🔐 Endpoint & Authentication
  • 🔁 Integration Flow (Diagram)
  • 📦 Sample Response
  • 📘 Parameter Definitions
  • 🔄 Bill Payment Mode Matrix
  • 💡 Integration Tips
  • ❌ Error Example
  • 🧠 Summary

docs.title: 🎯 What Is the Service Catalog
docs.text:
The Service Catalog is a structured configuration of:

  • Available service categories and subcategories
  • All API-ready services
  • Their dynamic input fields
  • Validation rules
  • UI hints like displayed vs hidden fields

You can use this catalog to:

  • 🏗️ Render service input screens
  • 🔁 Know which APIs to call (inquiry, fees, payment)
  • 📤 Generate payloads based on dynamic parameters

docs.title: 📘 Service Catalog API
docs.text: The Service Catalog API returns all the services granted to you. This is the entry point for dynamically generating UI components based on backend configurations.

docs.title: 🛠️ First-Time Use
docs.text:
How to Use

When calling the API for the first time, make sure to pass the following header:

Required Header (First-Time Only)
ServiceListVersion: 0

This ensures you receive the full list of available services dynamically from the backend.

RESTGraphQLgRPC 
GET https://test.momkn.org/gateway/api/v2/categories/0
Authorization: Bearer {token}
UserName: yourUsername
ChannelIdentifier: yourChannel
ServiceListVersion: 0

query {
 serviceCatalog(version: 0) {
  id
  name
  services {
    serviceID
    serviceName
  }
}
}

rpc GetServiceCatalog (ServiceCatalogRequest) returns (ServiceCatalogResponse);

docs.title: 📘 Parameter Definitions
docs.text: Field Description serviceID Unique ID used in all API calls inquirable Whether the service requires an inquiry step paymentModeID Payment method:1 = Fixed, 2 = Partial, 3 = In Advance billPaymentModeID Bill mode:1 = One, 2 = All, 3 = Multiple invoices optional false = mandatory fieldtrue = optional displayed true = shown to userfalse = sent silently in background valueTypeID Input type:1 = Numeric, 2 = String, 3 = Dropdown, 4 = Date, 6 = Decimal

docs.title: Product Catalog
docs.text: Display Service Paramnetrs

docs.title: 🧾 Overview
docs.text:
Microfinance installment payment services provide customers with the ability to repay microloans via secure digital channels. These services feature a set of APIs designed for seamless and reliable interactions between:

  • 💼 Financial platforms
  • 🏦 Microfinance institutions (MFIs)
  • 👤 End customers

docs.title: 🔧 Key Functionalities
docs.text: • 🔁 Real-time loan installment inquiries Retrieve outstanding balances, due dates, and installment schedules.

docs.title: 💲 Pricing/Monetization
docs.text: N/A

docs.title: 📦 Packaging/Bundling
docs.text: N/A

docs.title: 📘 Overview
docs.text:
Teleco Fintech is a digital financial platform designed to streamline and enhance telecom-based financial services. It enables customers to perform various financial operations such as bill inquiries, payments, and airtime services through secure and user-friendly APIs.

This product integrates with multiple telecom operators, providing a centralized service layer that supports:

  • 🔁 Real-time bill inquiry and payment for telecom services (e.g., mobile, internet).
  • 📡 Airtime services, including top-up and voucher issuance across supported telecom networks.
  • 🔐 Token-based authentication (e.g., JWT) for secure and authorized access to financial operations.
  • 📑 Comprehensive transaction logging and reconciliation to ensure transparency, accuracy, and traceability.

The APIs are built using a microservices architecture and adhere to modern security and compliance standards, ensuring:

  • 🔒 Encrypted, authenticated communication
  • 📈 Scalable, high-availability services for partners

docs.title: 💲 Pricing/Monetization
docs.text: N/A

docs.title: 📦 Packaging/Bundling
docs.text: REST API

docs.title: 📝 Description
docs.text:
خدمة فرصة - تقسيط بدون فوائد توفر لك إمكانية معرفة بيانات الفاتورة الخاصة بك قبل السداد.

×

docs.title: Toc Sidebar
docs.text:
It's filled with information specific to this page.

It's locked to the screen just like the ToC!

docs.title: Request
Response
FORSA - Fees API
docs.text: REST GraphQL gRPC

docs.title: 📝 Description
docs.text: احسب قيمة الفاتورة النهائية من خلال خدمة حساب الرسوم بناءً على بيانات الاستعلام السابقة.

docs.title: ✅ Endpoint
docs.text: POST /v2/services/{serviceId}/fees

docs.title: 📥 Request
📤 Response
docs.text:
{
  "Code": 200,
  "Message": "Fees calculated",
  "totalAmount": 5050,
  "brn": 123456,
  "fees": 50,
  "taxes": 0,
  "discount": 0,
  "amount": 5000,
  "Data": []
}

docs.title: FORSA - Inquiry API
docs.text: REST GraphQL gRPC

docs.title: 📝 Description
docs.text: خدمة فرصة - تقسيط بدون فوائد توفر لك إمكانية معرفة بيانات الفاتورة الخاصة بك قبل السداد.

docs.title: ✅ Endpoint
docs.text: POST /v2/services/{serviceId}/inquiry

docs.title: 📥 Request
📤 Response
docs.text:
{
  "Code": 200,
  "Message": "Success",
  "Brn": 123456,
  "Data": [],
  "invoices": []
}

docs.title: FORSA - Payment API
docs.text: REST GraphQL gRPC

docs.title: 📝 Description
docs.text: بعد تنفيذ الاستعلام وحساب الرسوم، يتم تنفيذ عملية الدفع النهائية لخدمة فرصة.

docs.title: ✅ Endpoint
docs.text: POST /v2/services/{serviceId}/payment

docs.title: 📥 Request
📤 Response
docs.text:
{
  "Code": 200,
  "Message": "Payment Successful",
  "totalAvailableBalance": 945.5,
  "receipt": [
    {
      "footer": "Thank you for using FORSA Installment"
    }
  ]
}
